wiki.content:
"Nobody Knows You When You're Down and Out" is a blues standard, written by Jimmy Cox in 1923. Its lyric, told from the point of view of a one-time millionaire during the Prohibition era, reflects on the fleeting nature of material wealth and the friendships that come and go with it.
 
 This version was recorded by Eric Clapton as part of MTV's Unplugged series.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Nobody Knows You When You're Down and Out" is a blues standard, written by Jimmy Cox in 1923. Its lyric, told from the point of view of a one-time millionaire during the Prohibition era, reflects on the fleeting nature of material wealth and the friendships that come and go with it.  This version was recorded by Eric Clapton as part of MTV's Unplugged series.

track.name: Nobody Knows You When You're Down and Out
comments: nobody loves you when you're down and out... Amen, brother. :)
As is the entire Unplugged cd. Love his sound.
First ! This song is very awesome .
